central_thesis: The central thesis is the presentation of the 'Path of Gnostic Light' as a practical, syncretic magical system (S.G.L.U.X.) for individual spiritual evolution and self-deification. It advocates for direct, experiential gnosis and conscious participation in the cosmic process of manifestation, transcending conventional dualities by integrating diverse esoteric traditions, particularly Thelema, Gnosticism, and Haitian Vodou-influenced practices, to achieve a profound state of unity with the Absolute.

structure_content.summary: This introduction outlines the author's personal journey into occultism, shaped by figures like Majstor Leo (Michael Bertiaux) and Kenneth Grant. It critiques naive romanticism in magic, advocating for a serious, experiential approach to spiritual development that integrates diverse esoteric systems and focuses on the underlying structure of reality and consciousness.

This chapter delves into the fundamental structure of existence, introducing the Thelemic concepts of Hadit and Nuit as primal polarities from which all manifestation (Primum Mobile) emerges. It employs a structuralist lens, comparing it to Levi-Strauss, to analyze the 'segmentation' of reality, emphasizing that the universe is a process of creation from undifferentiated chaos through these core dualities, which define the relationship between ego and the Absolute.

Defining Gnosis as direct, mystical experience rather than dogmatic belief, this chapter traces the historical development of Gnosticism from early Christian heresies to modern revivals. It highlights the role of Majstor Leo (Michael Bertiaux) in the formation of the S.G.L.U.X. (Societas Gnostica Lux ex Tenebris), presenting it as a contemporary Gnostic-Thelemic order focused on practical, experiential magic for achieving transcendent knowledge and self-realization.

This chapter provides a detailed exposition of the S.G.L.U.X. system, positioning it as a practical magical path derived from the teachings of Majstor Leo and Israel Regardie. It explains the system's initiatory structure, which involves four main stages and numerous substages, linking them to a comprehensive metaphysical framework that draws from Thelema, Kabbalah, and elements of Voudon, all geared towards the expansion of consciousness and spiritual transformation.

Initiation is presented as a symbolic 'beginning' and a conscious entry into new phases of spiritual development, moving beyond everyday consciousness. The chapter contrasts primitive initiatory rites with those of modern occult orders like S.G.L.U.X., emphasizing that true initiation is an internal transformation and energetic shift rather than a mere external ceremony. It outlines the specific initiatory degrees within S.G.L.U.X. and their cosmic correspondences.

This chapter explores the archetypal symbolism of masculine and feminine principles, as embodied in 'Beauty and the Beast.' It traces these concepts through various mythologies and occult systems (e.g., Horus-Set, Shiva-Shakti), linking them to the fundamental Hadit and Nuit polarities. The Beast (666) is reinterpreted not as evil but as a symbol of the Solar Child, and the serpent and dove represent core energies of creation and consciousness, all unified within the Kabbalistic Tree of Life.

These alchemical colors symbolize stages of the Great Work and different magical modalities (white, black, red magic). The chapter discusses duality (e.g., God/Devil, ego/non-ego) and the necessity of transcending it through 'balancing' forces. It contextualizes these colors within the Golden Dawn's Kabbalistic framework (Klifot) and the S.G.L.U.X. system, highlighting how practitioners integrate these aspects to achieve a balanced, unified consciousness and overcome limitations.

This chapter delves into the profound symbolism and practical application of the Serpent (Kundalini, chthonic energy) and the Lion (Solar energy, divine will) across diverse esoteric traditions. It explains Kundalini's role in the human energetic system (chakras, ida/pingala) as a key to spiritual awakening. The S.G.L.U.X. system integrates specific 'Snake' and 'Lion' techniques for raising and directing these energies to achieve higher states of consciousness and magical power.

This chapter focuses on Aiwass, the intelligence behind Aleister Crowley's *The Book of the Law*, presenting him as a cosmic messenger inaugurating the Aeon of Horus (Aquarius). It explains the Thelemic concept of 'True Will' as the individual's unique destiny aligned with cosmic law. The discussion covers the astrological significance of the Age of Aquarius and the importance of connecting with such cosmic intelligences for collective and individual spiritual evolution, emphasizing an 'internal' rather than external God concept.

The 'Word of the Aeon,' ABRAHADABRA, is explored as a potent magical formula for transformation in the new era. The chapter connects this word to Kabbalistic principles, the Tetragrammaton (JHVH), and the emanations of divinity (Father, Mother, Son, Daughter). It examines the concept of 'twins' in creation and transformation, emphasizing the integration of various divine aspects to achieve a unified, self-realized state, representing the Great Work.

This section functions as a practical grimoire, detailing a system based on the ABRAHADABRA formula and its planetary correspondences. It describes four initiatory processes: Incarnation, Living, Transcending Illusion, and Resurrection (into the Fourth Dimension). The 'Planetary System of Abrahadabra' diagram and the 'Cosmic Journey through Abrahadabra' technique are presented as methods for spiritual evolution, connecting the formula's letters to body chakras and cosmic planes.

This allegorical narrative describes a journey to find 'The Star,' symbolizing ultimate truth and gnosis. It links the star to the Bethlehem star, representing a new era and divine manifestation. The story reinforces themes of inner discovery, the quest for authentic knowledge, and the profound significance of key Thelemic numerology (11, 93, 418) in understanding the cosmic narrative and one's place within it.

This appendix provides step-by-step instructions for the 'Abrahadabra Technique,' a practical method involving extensive visualization of light pathways and the vibratory chanting of letters corresponding to specific energetic centers and cosmic principles within the practitioner's body, aiming to integrate micro- and macrocosmic forces.

structure_content.chapter_title: Dodatak B: Telemitska Verzija Rituala Pentagrama
structure_content.summary: This appendix details the Thelemic version of the Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram. It includes precise instructions for performing gestures (e.g., Puer, Vir, Mulier, Tishine) and vibrating specific divine names and words (e.g., Satan, Ma, Tau, Babalon, Hadit, Nuit, Io Pan), transforming a foundational banishing ritual into a potent Thelemic magical operation for energetic cleansing and invocation.

This appendix offers step-by-step instructions for the 'Snake Technique.' Performed in conjunction with the Pentagram Ritual, it involves visualizing a serpent moving through the body to facilitate entry into 'other worlds' or non-ordinary states of consciousness, allowing the practitioner to engage with and explore different dimensions of existence through symbolic identification with the serpent.

This appendix provides step-by-step instructions for the 'Dove Technique.' Similar to the Snake Technique, it uses visualization of a dove entering and exiting the body during a Pentagram Ritual to enable conscious interaction with 'other worlds,' symbolizing the practitioner's ability to navigate different planes of existence and return, often associated with accessing higher, more ethereal realms.

key_concepts.definition: A modern Gnostic and Thelemic magical order, founded by Majstor Leo (Michael Bertiaux), focused on experiential gnosis and practical magic, synthesizing various traditions to guide practitioners through an initiatory path of self-transformation.

Direct, intuitive, experiential knowledge of divine truth, a profound inner realization that transcends and is distinct from dogmatic faith or intellectual understanding, forming the core of the S.G.L.U.X. path.

A key Thelemic magical word, representing the Great Work, the union of micro- and macrocosm. In this system, it is a potent formula for achieving the 'Word of the Aeon' and facilitating spiritual evolution, with its letters corresponding to energetic centers and cosmic processes.

Fundamental Thelemic cosmic principles: Nuit is infinite space and infinite stars, representing the Absolute All; Hadit is the infinitely contracted point, the essence of individuality and the dynamic creative urge. Their polarity and interplay generate all manifestation.

The intelligence who dictated *The Book of the Law* to Aleister Crowley. In Salihović's work, Aiwass is seen as a cosmic messenger heralding a new aeon (Aeon of Horus/Aquarius), guiding humanity towards 'True Will' and a deeper understanding of cosmic law.

The 'serpent power' or vital spiritual energy, coiled at the base of the spine. Its awakening and ascent through the body's chakras are central to the practical magic of S.G.L.U.X., leading to heightened consciousness and profound spiritual experiences.

A ritual adapted from the Golden Dawn's Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram, used by Thelemites and in S.G.L.U.X. for banishing unwanted influences and invoking desired energies, utilizing specific gestures and vibratory formulas with Thelemic divine names.

A significant figure in modern occultism and a primary influence on Salihović. Bertiaux's work synthesizes Thelema, Gnosticism, and Haitian Vodou, providing a unique framework for practical magic and initiatory systems like S.G.L.U.X.

key_concepts.term: Kosmički Tok Abrahadabra (Cosmic Flow of Abrahadabra)
key_concepts.definition: A advanced meditative and ritualistic technique described within the 'Grimuar Abrahadabra' that uses the Abrahadabra formula to consciously navigate and explore different dimensions and planes of existence, fostering a deep connection with cosmic consciousness.

practical_system.description: The S.G.L.U.X. system presented is a comprehensive, operative initiatory path designed for individual spiritual evolution and self-deification. It is highly syncretic, weaving together elements of Thelema, Gnosticism, Haitian Vodou, Kabbalah, and Eastern Tantra (Kundalini yoga). The core objective is to transcend manifest duality and attain unity with the Absolute ('Apsolut') through a process of 'de-identification' from limited perceptions and 're-identification' with deeper cosmic realities. The system emphasizes direct, 'gnostic' experience over dogma, providing explicit techniques for manipulating energy and consciousness across physical, astral, mental, and spiritual planes.
tools: Vibration of divine names, magical words, and mantras (e.g., ABRAHADABRA, Io Pan, SATAN)
Symbolic correspondences derived from Kabbalah (Tree of Life, Sephiroth, paths), planetary sigils, and elemental associations
Chakra work and Kundalini awakening techniques for energy manipulation and ascent
Pentagrams and other geometric figures used in ritual space construction and energetic direction
Symbolic identification (e.g., with the serpent or dove) for shifting consciousness and interacting with different planes.
rituals: Thelemic Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (adapted for S.G.L.U.X. with specific gestures and vibratory formulas)
Abrahadabra Technique (visualization and vibration of letters through energetic centers)
Snake Technique (visualization of a serpent for traversing 'other worlds')
Dove Technique (visualization of a dove for traversing 'other worlds')
Cosmic Journey through Abrahadabra (an advanced technique for cosmic travel and exploration)
Invocation of Aiwass/Messenger of Aquarius (techniques for establishing contact with cosmic intelligences)

relevant_quotes.text: Ja sam pakleni Dajimon... Ja sam užurbana zmija svetog prokletstva... Mi smo nosioci zakona... ZVIJEZDA... Vozi nas u kočiji nebeskoj sveti anđele Aiwass-e.
Magija je, kao i mit, snolika djelatnost, uzlet duha i imaginacije, sve do granica prekoračenja samih sebe, sve do završetka jednog, a ustoličenja drugog svijeta, toliko sličnog snevanju.
Ništa je tajni ključ ovog zakona.
Ja sam Zmija koja daje Znanje i Užtak i sjajnu slavu i potičem srca ljudi pijanstvom.
Radi šta ti je volja i to neka bude čitav zakon. Riječ zakona je Thelema.
Onda je ova povučena linija ključ: onda je ovaj krug kvadriran u svom neuspjehu ključ takođe. I Abrahadabra.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant within contemporary Western Esotericism, particularly for those engaged with modern Gnosticism, Thelema, and syncretic magical systems influenced by figures like Michael Bertiaux and Kenneth Grant. It offers a unique synthesis that provides a practical, experience-driven pathway to spiritual evolution, challenging dogmatic approaches by emphasizing direct gnosis and the active manipulation of consciousness to bridge manifest and unmanifest realities.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience comprises advanced practitioners and students of Western Esotericism, especially Thelemites, Gnostics, and those interested in Chaos Magic or the esoteric systems derived from Michael Bertiaux's work. It also appeals to academics studying modern occultism who seek deep technical insights into operative magical practices and their philosophical underpinnings. A foundational understanding of various esoteric traditions, particularly Kabbalah and Thelema, is assumed.
